> Sadly, I didn't qualify for the Overseas Research Scholarship (pretty much
> the only recourse for PhD funding for non UK/EU students here), so I'll be
> returning to the US this autumn. I'm hoping to start a phd in fall '05
> (since i missed the app deadlines for this next year). Any suggestions at
> universities in the US doing interesting work? (UT already turned me down
> once ... I wonder if I should reapply?)

I think there was a thread about this before, but I don't remember. I've
met with both Rik Belew at UCSD and also Jordan Pollack who is at
Brandeis. Both of them seem to be doing research that you would be
interested in. Also there is a group in Florida I think, with Annie Wu,
but I'm not too familiar with her work.

> Also, I'm hoping to find some position next year (fall '04) as a research
> assistant or something ... any suggestions about places that might hire
> non-phds?

You might want to look into some corporate research labs. I know IBM
Research hires even undergrad interns, and I'm pretty sure there are a few
other places around the country. As for academic labs, I'm not sure what
the policies are like. Ken might be able to add some insight.

Joe

-- 

Joseph Reisinger
